rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must include at least two of those tags concatenated with additional characters, spaces, or punctuation marks.
input: sentence: The weather is good today., word: today
validityText:
The input consists of a sentence and a word. The sentence "The weather is good today." is a grammatically valid string containing multiple words. It does not contain special characters or symbols that are not part of normal linguistic usage. The word "today" is a substring of the sentence. The word does not include punctuation. Thus, the input complies with all the rules specified in the input specification.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output provides a single word "NOUN". The description specifies that the chatbot should return only the part-of-speech tag. "NOUN" is a valid part-of-speech tag and aligns with the tags listed in the description. It does not include any extra information or formatting.
OK
